oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old log schoolhouse in Great Smoky Mountains National Park
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A man wearing a white shirt and a tie leans against a log structure. Two windows can be seen at his left. The logs are wide-cut with dovetail notches, and the roof is shake.

Possibly the Little Greenbrier School located in what is now the Great Smoky Mountains National Park (GSMNP). The park was built with the assistance of the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC), a New Deal agency designed to provide jobs for young Depression-era men on relief.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Log buildings; National parks & reserves; One-room schools; Rural schools; Schools
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grossman
